alert.note: Alert for Carlton, South St. Louis; Central St. Louis; Koochiching; North Cass; North Itasca; North St. Louis; Northern Aitkin; Northern Cook, Northern Lake; South Cass; South Itasca; Southern Cook, North Shore; Southern Lake, North Shore (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Duluth (Northeast Minnesota and Northern Wisconsin)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued November 07 at 2:43PM CST by NWS Duluth
info.description: ...WINTER STORM LIKELY TO IMPACT THE NORTHLAND STARTING THURSDAY AND LAST INTO FRIDAY NIGHT... A low pressure system is expected to bring snowfall to northern Minnesota starting Thursday morning. Two to four inches of snow is possible by Thursday evening in Itasca, Koochiching and northern St. Louis counties. Thursday night into Friday morning snowfall expands southward to the US Highway 2 corridor, along the North Shore and towards the Twin Ports. Snow lasts into Friday night across most of northern Minnesota. Total snowfall north and west of the Iron Range could be 4 to 8 inches. There is a high potential that travel will be impacted by this storm, especially in Itasca, Koochiching and St. Louis counties. A Winter Storm Watch could be issued soon. Visit weather.gov/duluth for the latest information.
